I think it's the proper place- why would you need a recipient type at all when not concerned with the wallet?\n
The createrawtransaction RPC could use something like CRecipient, even without wallet support.\n

I guess so, but that'd be completely internal to that call - which is already very simple, and a pure utility method at that. So you'd have two unconnected parts of the source code somehow using the same data type. No, I don't really see that as useful code change. We already have CTxOut. Also there is something to be said for keeping the payment server code somewhat more generic (e.g. future library).
